title: Farming cape

properties.value: The Farming cape can be purchased for 99,000 coins alongside the Farming hood from Martin the Master Gardener at Draynor Village by players who have achieved skill mastery (level 99) in Farming. It is the Cape of Accomplishment for the Farming skill.

SMW Subobject for UntrimmedHigh Alchemy value: 59400Examine: The cape worn by master farmers.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Farming capeUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Farming cape.pngWeight: 0.453Value: 99000Version anchor: UntrimmedRelease date: 18 October 2006Item ID: 9810

The Farming cape can be purchased for 99,000 coins alongside the Farming hood from Martin the Master Gardener at Draynor Village by players who have achieved skill mastery (level 99) in Farming. It is the Cape of Accomplishment for the Farming skill.

A player performing the farming cape's emote.

Like all skill capes, the Farming cape gives +9 to all defensive stats, and also a +4 bonus to prayer if it is trimmed, which requires a separate skill at level 99. The cape is automatically trimmed if this condition is met.

When the farming cape is equipped, herb patches will have a 5% increase in yield. This effect stacks additively with the magic secateurs. It also provides unlimited teleports to the Farming Guild in the Kebos Lowlands. Unlike the magic secateurs, this cape does not increase yield when harvesting herbs off a Herbiboar.[1]

Like all skillcapes, except the Quest point cape, equipping the cape or using the "Boost" option in the equipment menu temporarily boosts Farming by +1, up to 100. This only affects the yield of limpwurt plants and belladonna.[2] Unequipping the cape will remove the boost, this boost cannot be used to restore temporary skill drains.

This item can be stored in the cape rack of a costume room, as part of the Farming cape set, along with the hood. Ultimate Ironmen will be unable to retrieve individual pieces until the full set is stored.

The cape is noteworthy for providing an unlimited, wearable teleport that brings the player close to both a bank and a Spirit tree, and therefore quick access to both the Grand Exchange and a player's house as well as other locations.

As of 1 May 2022, there are 148,539 current members that have achieved level 99 in Farming.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 January 2019
(update)

The option to teleport to the Farming Guild was added.

3 December 2015
(update | poll)

When equipped, the Farming cape grants a 5% increased yield from herb patches (stacks with magic secateurs).

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 14 July 2021. (Archived from the original on 13:20, 14 July 2021 (UTC).) Mod Ash: "Didn't see any benefits from [the Farming cape] in its code."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 13 October 2020. (Archived from the original on 31 January 2022.) Mod Ash: "[harvesting limpwurts is a base of 3 + scaling +1 for each 10 levels, 90-99 being +9, does boosting to 100+ then result in +10?]It's picking a random number between 0 and (stat - 1) inclusive. So if you boost to 101, it has a small chance to roll 100, which would give the +10.(in addition to the base of 3). [are there any other farming patches/crops that are affected by boosts above 100?] Belladonna has something similar."

The '''Farming cape''' can be purchased for 99,000 [[coins]] alongside the [[Farming hood]] from [[Martin the Master Gardener]] at [[Draynor Village]] by players who have achieved [[skill mastery]] (level 99) in [[Farming]]. It is the [[Cape of Accomplishment]] for the Farming [[Skills|skill]].
[[File:Farming cape emote.gif|190px|thumb|A player performing the farming cape's emote.]]
Like all [[Capes of Achievement|skill capes]], the Farming cape gives +9 to all [[Equipment Stats#Defence bonuses|defensive stats]], and also a +4 bonus to [[Equipment Stats#Other bonuses|prayer]] if it is trimmed, which requires a separate skill at level 99. The cape is automatically trimmed if this condition is met.

When the farming cape is equipped, [[herb patches]] will have a 5% increase in yield. This effect stacks additively with the [[magic secateurs]]. It also provides unlimited teleports to the [[Farming Guild]] in the [[Kebos Lowlands]]. Unlike the [[magic secateurs]], this cape does not increase yield when harvesting herbs off a [[Herbiboar]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1415251704812027904|date=14 July 2021|archiveurl=https://archive.is/00r5m|archivedate=13:20, 14 July 2021 (UTC)|quote=Didn't see any benefits from [the Farming cape] in its code.}}

Like all skillcapes, except the [[Quest point cape]], equipping the cape or using the "''Boost''" option in the equipment menu temporarily [[boost]]s Farming by +1, up to 100. This '''only''' affects the yield of [[limpwurt plant]]s and [[belladonna]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1315965010309414916|date=13 October 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/k0VbL|archivedate=31 January 2022|quote=[harvesting limpwurts is a base of 3 + scaling +1 for each 10 levels, 90-99 being +9, does boosting to 100+ then result in +10?]It's picking a random number between 0 and (stat - 1) inclusive. So if you boost to 101, it has a small chance to roll 100, which would give the +10.(in addition to the base of 3). [are there any other farming patches/crops that are affected by boosts above 100?] Belladonna has something similar.}} Unequipping the cape will remove the boost, this boost cannot be used to restore [[temporary skill drain]]s.

{{Costume storage|cape rack|Farming cape set, along with the [[Farming hood|hood]]|set=true}}

The cape is noteworthy for providing an unlimited, wearable teleport that brings the player close to both a bank and a [[Spirit tree]], and therefore quick access to both the Grand Exchange and a player's [[Player-owned house|house]] as well as other locations.
